sec.title: What is already known about this topic?
sec.p: Antiretroviral therapy (ART) adherence is crucial for viral suppression, a critical outcome for maintaining health in persons with HIV infection. Hispanic/Latino men who have sex with men (MSM) have disproportionately high HIV infection rates; their barriers to ART adherence have not been extensively explored.

sec.title: What is added by this report?
sec.p: ART adherence was lower among younger Hispanic/Latino MSM and those who experienced poverty or reported drug use, depression, or unmet ancillary service needs. The most common reason for missing ART doses was forgetting (63.1%); 63.9% who missed doses reported multiple reasons.

sec.title: What are the implications for public health practice?
sec.p: Expanding access to ancillary services among Hispanic/Latino MSM, particularly those experiencing barriers to ART adherence, might improve clinical outcomes.
